page.title: 20Keswick's Mountain Rescue
page.content: The mountain rescue are called out on average sixty times a year.If there is somebody unconscious a special machine is used that pumps out hot air to revive them.The team consists of about forty four men most of them in their fifties.One experience was finding a little boy at the bottom of Helvellyn.This happened when he and his father were on the top of Helvellyn.The boy wanted a last look at the view so he walked towards the crag.Having no grips he slipped on the ice and could not save himself and fell off.On some occasions the mountain rescue have needed the helicopter to rescue people.It is used about three times a year on average and it is kept at R.A.F.B.This stands for Royal Air Force Boulmer.
